subject: Travel
subcategory: The Story of Maps and Navigation
title: Mapping Terra Australis
description: Learn Mapping Terra Australis in one minute.

hook.text: For centuries, European maps showed a giant southern continent called Terra Australis that didn't exist.

buildup.text: Ancient Greeks believed a massive southern landmass must exist to balance the weight of the northern continents.

discovery.text: Mapmakers drew it on charts for 1,500 years. Explorers kept searching for it and finding only ocean.

twist.text: When Dutch sailors finally found Australia, it was much smaller than expected. The grand theory was wrong.

climax.text: The name 'Australia' comes from Terra Australis. A fictional continent named a real one.

punchline.text: An imaginary continent gave a real one its name.

quiz.question: What was Terra Australis?
options: A mythical southern continent shown on maps for centuries
